title: Are master’s admissions for Fall 2021 going to be delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is too soon to tell the effect of COVID-19 on the Fall 2021 admissions. Universities, at large, are hopeful that operations will start running smoothly by then. Though, I should mention that there will be some tough competition in 2021 during admissions. This is because many students have either deferred their education or are thinking of applying for a Master’s next year. It is likely these students will face tough competition as colleges will receive applications in large numbers. This, however, is just a speculation. Fall 2020 is the best time to apply for your master’s because there is less competition. Many universities have even let go off the admission requirements of standardized tests → Northeastern University - Standardized Academic Tests Waived Off You can watch this video to know more about the impact of COVID-19 on Fall 2021 admissions. Well if we look at the admission cycle in India, majorly the university academic year starts in end of July or first week of august, We are still in end of April, a full three months away from start of the next academic year. According to most experts the pandemic curve will peak out around mid may in India and then it will flatten. With large number of measures being taken including lockdown, social distancing and now even the antidote and vaccine are almost ready, In my opinion I see the session starting on time. And regarding admissions, almost all the major education leaders have already started the online admissions processes including the entrance tests some large universities like LPU have even concluded the video interviews for Management programs. Even in worst case scenario I don’t see the admissions and academic session delaying beyond one month from normal times. I hope this serves the query. DVD

There is most likely going to be a delay in the academic calendar, with courses starting on a later date. Universities are also providing students with the choice of commencing their courses online and moving to the study destination once things go back to normal. Universities as well as the government are offering all avenues of support to international students.
Nope! the admission for Fall 21 will not be delayed due to COVID. It might impact the Spring 21 admission but not fall.
